result.title: Weekly training #2: Dynamic Programming
result.content:
Hello everyone, I hope you had a nice weekend. As promised, today we will start a new training. It is a bit unusual, it will last 2 weeks this time -- be prepared to strive in this round, and its main theme is Dynamic Programming. The number of problems this time is astronomical, just work at your own paces, we can add few more days if needed :)

Big thanks to these gentlemen, RedNextYears and PrinceOfPersia, for helping me setting this round (Applause to them please).

You can find all problems here.
(Thank you again RedNextYears)

Note: As usual you can discuss problems here.

Note: If you know some good resources about dynamic programming techniques, share them with us.

Note: Topcoder is a good resource for dynamic programming problems. The reason we didn't include them here, is that there is no way of adding them to the scoreboard and thus will ruin the contest's atmosphere. However, I'll try to compile some good problems separately in another sheet and give them to you as a bonus at the end of this contest. Problem propositions are welcome in here.

Let the Party Begins

UPD: After 3 weeks the contest has ended. I hope you enjoyed the problems. Please, share with us your experiences.
Also, I won't be available the upcoming two weeks. In the meantime try to read about graph theory, as it will be our main theme in the next training.
